image.altText: Australian golf legend and former LIV Golf CEO Greg Norman.

props.synopsis: South Australia could continue to host LIV Golf for at least another six years, with the state government unveiling plans to invest in a Greg Norman-designed upgrade to the North Adelaide golf course at a cost the premier said would become publicly available "within the state budget".

title.children: LIV Golf locked in, with mooted move to Greg Norman-designed course

image.altText: A weapon allegedly uncovered by SA Police.

props.synopsis: A home-owner injured by a thief during a robbery in regional SA will face court charged with weapons offences after detectives allegedly uncovered items — including an explosive — following the break-in, police say.

title.children: Break-in victim arrested after explosive found, SA Police says

image.altText: 'Welcome to Genius Gungahlin' sign on a building.

props.synopsis: Genius Childcare centre in Gungahlin will be temporarily shut down by the ACT regulator after it received a spate of reports about child health and safety breaches.

title.children: Canberra childcare centre temporarily shut after SA site forced to close

image.altText: A school class photo featuring more than 20 students with one child left out. The left out child is symbolized by a silhouette

props.synopsis: As South Australia's parliament considers new child protection laws, advocates are questioning whether the state has become "over-zealous" in protecting children from harm.

title.children: Student's removal from class photos sparks debate over SA's child protection laws

image.altText: A beautiful large black snake with orange stripes

props.synopsis: It has been a "flat out" summer for snake catchers dealing with the slithering reptiles around Adelaide and nearby towns, while a vet reports treating more bites than usual.

title.children: More snake sightings in SA this summer with hatchlings on the way

image.altText: Joaquin Niemann waves his hat to the crowd as CHAMPION is visible on the big screen

props.synopsis: Chile's Joaquin Niemann has fired a seven-under final round to win LIV Golf's Adelaide tournament by two strokes from Mexico's Abraham Ancer.

title.children: Niemann wins LIV Adelaide as Aussie team fails to fire

image.altText: close up of man playing a saxophone

props.synopsis: One of the longest-performing and most far-out jazz outfits ever seen, on this planet at least, is coming to Australia.

title.children: Jazz band to 'transmoleculise' into Australia for Womadelaide

image.altText: A packet of Little Dough Co. mini fruit hot cross buns.

props.synopsis: Food Standards Australia New Zealand issues a recall of a hot cross bun product it says is sold online and at Foodland supermarkets in South Australia.

title.children: Hot cross buns recalled at SA supermarkets because of glass hazard

image.altText: Woman holding sign with kids and famer husband perched at the end of a stone work Orroroo Sign

props.synopsis: Almost two dozen regional councils in South Australia have banded together to share how childcare shortage is impacting parents living in their region.

title.children: The challenges of living in one of Australia's worst childcare deserts

image.altText: A court build with a columned verandah and a blue coloured building behind

props.synopsis: A man who snatched a one-year-old from a pram on a bus in Adelaide's northern suburbs has been released from custody without further penalty after spending six months behind bars.

title.children: Man who snatched baby on SA bus released from custody

image.altText: Lisa Cunningham

props.synopsis: Prosecutors will not seek the death penalty for a former South Australian woman awaiting trial in the United States over the death of her stepdaughter.

title.children: Death penalty dropped against SA woman awaiting trial over stepdaughter's death

image.altText: Victoria Police Acting Assistant Commissioner Shane Patton speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Victoria's police chief, Shane Patton, resigned from his role just two days after a no-confidence vote from his officers.

title.children: Victorian premier says 'overwhelming' vote led to police chief's exit

image.altText: A man with short grey hair and glasses wearing a suit, sitting behind a microphone icking up a piece of paper as he speaks

props.synopsis: Australia needs to take a leaf out of the Trump administration's book and be more aggressive in pushing countries to take back their citizens that commit violent offences, a former home affairs boss says.

title.children: Former home affairs boss says Australia should take leaf out of Trump book — as it happened

image.altText: Mobile vision of three shirtless men on a street with a crowd in the background.

props.synopsis: A chaotic brawl took place outside Finns Beach Club in Canggu last week, with footage posted to social media allegedly showing shirtless men beating security guards with wooden blocks.

title.children: Australian suspect in alleged Bali assault identified by police

image.altText: A young mother sits on grass with her three young daughters, who are all smiling at each other

props.synopsis: Australian schooling is changing, with more than 1.5 million students now attending private schools, new data reveals.

title.children: Parental exodus from public schools continues for another year

image.altText: A crowd of people shopping in Pitt St Mall, Sydney.

props.synopsis: It seems beyond either the wit or the political muscle of Australia's political leaders to set an immigration target, let alone to meet it.

title.children: Australian immigration is a mess, controlled by business and universities

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Weak results from the likes of Bendigo and Adelaide Bank and Westpac have driven the ASX down after a mixed end to the week on Wall Street. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX tumbles on weak bank results, Bendigo Bank and Westpac hit hard

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Star Entertainment receives refinancing deal, struggling to continue "as a going concern"
ASX slumps 0.8pc, weighed down by banks, Suncorp
ASX slumps 0.8pc, weighed down by banks

image.altText: Three women cropped together into one photo

props.synopsis: Almost three quarters of households with a mortgage in the electorate of Lyons are in stress — and a handful of votes may decide the key seat next federal election.

title.children: 'People can't keep going like this': Inside a mortgage-stressed electorate

image.altText: Keir Starmer and a smiling Volodymyr Zelenskyy shaking hands in front of UK and Ukrainian flags and two white lecterns

props.synopsis: Keir Starmer said the UK plays a leading role in supporting Kyiv in its war with Russia, which includes being willing to offer British peacekeeping troops in a bid to guarantee the European nation's security.

title.children: UK PM offers peacekeeping troops in Ukraine for 'security' of continent

image.altText: Albanese wears a high-vis vest and white hard hat on a construction site with others.

props.synopsis: Labor has long held these outer-suburban electorates in Australia's mortgage belts. Tomorrow's Reserve Bank interest rate decision will heavily shape the party's hold on them.

title.children: Suburban Melbourne and Perth home to nation's most indebted electorates

image.altText: 25-year-old Mikey Madison has won the 2025 BAFTA Award for best actress.

props.synopsis: Post-WWII epic The Brutalist and papal drama Conclave have tied for most wins at the 2025 BAFTA awards.

title.children: Anora's Mikey Madison trumps Demi Moore for best actress at BAFTAs

image.altText: pedestrians walk past the reserve bank of australia building

props.synopsis: Millions of households are hoping financial relief is closer than ever as the RBA meets for the first time this year, where it is widely expected to cut interest rates.

title.children: We're about to find out if the RBA will deliver interest rate relief

image.altText: Macro Rubio and Benjamin Netanyahu shake hands behind podiums after a press conference.

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu made the comments alongside US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, a day after his country received a shipment of American made heavy bombs.

title.children: Phase two of Gaza ceasefire looms as Israeli PM vows 'hell' if truce ends

image.altText: Protestors with big blue signs reading "Save the Maugean Skate" and "Fish Farms = Extinction".

props.synopsis: The recent letter from the prime minister to the salmon industry has been interpreted as a guarantee salmon farming will continue on Tasmania's west coast. But there's still a lot we don't know.

title.children: What the PM left unsaid about his pre-election salmon intervention

image.altText: A$AP Rocky sitting in court

props.synopsis: The rapper rejected a plea deal and faces trial on two counts of felony assault stemming from a 2021 shooting in Hollywood.

title.children: A$AP Rocky could face up to 24 years in jail for felony assault charges

image.altText: Jacob Kiplimo raises his arms

props.synopsis: Uganda's Jacob Kiplimo made the most of perfect conditions in Barcelona to take 48 seconds off the previous world record, the largest jump in history.

title.children: 'Astonishing': World half marathon record smashed by historic margin

image.altText: A photo of Alyssia with her blonde hair in a bun, wearing black glasses. She's holding a notebook and pen.

props.synopsis: Think you've mastered adulthood? Alyssia Moolenschot, who runs a program that helps young people navigate life after school, wants to put your practical knowledge to the test.

title.children: How many basic life skills do you have? Try our pop quiz to find out

image.altText: A Hillcrest Primary School sign with hundreds of bunches of flowers arranged on the ground nearby, a

props.synopsis: In November last year, the Devonport Magistrates Court heard two weeks of detailed evidence into how the Hillcrest Primary School tragedy unfolded. The accused and the victims' families return to court today as lawyers make their closing submissions.

title.children: Hillcrest tragedy criminal case nears end as families return to court

image.altText: Guro Reiten and Sam Kerr stand arm in arm smiling for the camera at Chelsea training.

props.synopsis: Fresh from her acquittal in court last week, Sam Kerr returns to Kingsmeadow to watch her Chelsea teammates extend their lead atop the Women's Super League table with a 2-1 win over Everton.

title.children: Kerr spotted in the crowd as Chelsea remains on top of Super League

image.altText: A player holds the ball overhead and looks for their next pass

props.synopsis: In Tonga, they make do with a car park after hours instead of a proper netball court, but it hasn't stopped these Pacific champions from rising to eighth in the world. Even when their top players have been unavailable for selection due to Super Netball commitments.

title.children: Veve relieved Tonga will be at full strength for Pacific netball series

image.altText: Taiwan's flag and China's flag appear in the background of a globe

props.synopsis: The US State Department has removed the phrase "we do not support Taiwan independence" on its website. Other changes were also made, including adding a statement that the US will support Taiwan's membership in international organisations "where applicable".

title.children: US drops website wording on not supporting Taiwan independence

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: At least one commanding officer has challenged Defence Minister Richard Marles's decision to strip commanders of medals over the conduct of soldiers in Afghanistan.

title.children: Delays expected as Australian soldier challenges loss of war medals

image.altText: A partially submerged red car in the flood water

props.synopsis: At least nine people die in the latest round of harsh weather in the United States, including eight during heavy rain in Kentucky.

title.children: Seven-year-old amongst dead amid US flooding

image.altText: A polaroid of a young couple

props.synopsis: After 33 years of marriage, Michael and Debbie Neat are proof reality TV dating shows can work.

title.children: Debbie was contestant number one and fell in love with Mike
